greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Column of Zorach additive triangle in which n appears (or 0 in the unlikely event that it does not).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Haskell programs for sequences in connection with Zorach additive triangle
example: a(8)=1 since 8 appears in the first (i.e. left hand) column.
xref: If a(n)=1 then n is in A035311, if a(n)=A072039(n) then n is in A035313. Cf. A035312, A035358, A072039.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 07 2002
